Title: Data Analyst I (They/She/He)
Description:
If you‚Äôre here, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre looking for an exciting ride.

A ride that will fuel up your ambitions to take on a new challenge and stretch yourself beyond your comfort zone.

We‚Äôll deliver a non-vanilla culture built on talent, where we work to amplify the impact on millions of people, paving the way forward together.

Not your usual app. We are the fastest-growing multi-category app connecting millions of users with businesses, and couriers, offering on-demand services from more than 170,000 local restaurants, grocers and supermarkets, and high street retail stores. We operate in more than 1500 cities across 25 countries.

Together we revolutionize the way people connect with their everyday needs, from delivering essentials to connecting our ecosystem of users through innovative solutions powered by technology. For us, every day is filled with purpose.

What makes our ride unique?

ü§ù Our culture and strong values.

üí™ Our career development philosophy.

ü§ù Our commitment to being a force for good.

We have a vision: To give everyone easy access to anything in their cities. And this is where your ride starts.

YOUR MISSION

Support the optimization of logistics features, with a focus on delivery areas and supply/demand imbalances, by maintaining and improving settings, quantifying their impact, providing data-driven insights, coordinating feature rollouts, and measuring their effectiveness.

THE JOURNEY


Work closely with local/regional stakeholders, product teams and development teams, serving as a bridge between product and operations, to define how to best set up and enable products, monitor and give visibility of metrics and KPIs.
Deep-dive on business metrics, in order to explore areas of opportunity and enable data-driven decision-making, based on applied statistics and probability techniques
Develop and maintain scalable and self-service visualization tools and storytelling dashboards.
Build optimization processes to define the best tuning of every feature on each geography.
Build robust relationships with stakeholders acting as a strategic and supportive link between the technology, business and product.
Support recurrent processes within the team, enabling the adjustment of tools to business needs
Continuously explore and refine key operational metrics (delivery time, efficiency, costs), gaining a comprehensive understanding of Glovo‚Äôs logistics.


What You Will Bring To The Ride


1-2 years of professional experience outside of an academic and internship setting, in a quantitative analysis role
Excellent SQL and Excel/GoogleSheet skills
Solid proficiency in statistical programming (Python/R) and experience working with popular tools such as Pandas, SciPy, Seaborn, Jupyter/iPython notebooks, R Markdown.
Knowledge of visualization tools like Tableau, Looker, PowerBI, ...
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills
Great spoken and written English.


Individuals representing diverse profiles, encompassing various genders, ethnicities, and backgrounds, are less likely to apply for this role if they do not possess solid experience in 100% of these areas. Even if it seems you don't meet our musts don't let it stop you, we are all about finding the best talent out there! Skills can be learned, and embracing diversity is invaluable


üí™ Top-notch private health insurance to keep you at your peak.
üçî Monthly Glovo credit to satisfy your cravings!
üí≥ Cobee discounts on transportation, food, and even kindergarten expenses.
üèä Discounted gym memberships to keep you energized.
üèñÔ∏è Extra time off, the freedom to work from home two days a week, and the opportunity to work from anywhere for up to three weeks a year!
üë™ Enhanced parental leave, and office-based nursery.
üß† Online therapy and wellbeing benefits to ensure your mental well-being.


Here at Glovo, we thrive on diversity, we believe it enhances our teams, products, and culture. We know that the best ideas come from a mashup of brilliant diverse minds. This is why we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds - all genders, racial/diverse backgrounds, abilities, ages, sexual orientations and all other unique characteristics that make you YOU. We will encourage you to bring your authentic self to work, fostering an inclusive environment where everyone feels heard.

Feel free to note your pronouns in your application (e.g., she/her/hers, he/him/his, they/them/theirs, etc).

So, ready to take the wheel and make this the ride of your life?

Delve into our culture by taking a peek at our Instagram and check out our Linkedin and website!

Description:

Fundada en Par√≠s en 2001, es una consultora independiente con una red de 29 oficinas en 18 pa√≠ses. Entre las marcas pertenecientes al Grupo Labelium se encuentran Labelium Play, Labelium Retail, tigrz, Feed Manager, M13H y KlickKoncept, entre otras.

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will


Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities


You Have


Analytical and data-driven mindset
Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market


Why join us


Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

HTML:
About REVER

Shoppers receive any purchase in 24h anywhere on the planet. Why can‚Äôt we also return & get refunded just as quickly? REVER is born to change how the world buys by giving superpowers to shoppers, because returning should be as easy as buying. We automate returns, refunds, and exchanges for ecommerce businesses across the globe. After being backed by Y-Combinator, market leading VCs and top founders from unicorns in Europe, we are now growing 10x yearly and expanding to more and more countries. To accelerate our growth even further, we are looking for game-changers to join our team.

We are like a sports team; we create an environment where everyone can give their max and we push each other to achieve our potential. We are data driven problem solvers, but most importantly fast learners. You‚Äôll immerse yourself in a vibrant, youthful atmosphere with a lot of potential to grow internally.

You Will

  • Be part of the Product Automations team at REVER, which is in the center of Logistics, Operations, Finance, Data Analytics and Tech teams.
  • Be involved in the product and roadmap definition process to solve customer needs.
  • Interact with REVER clients and REVER internal Teams to understand their requests, needs & priorities
  • Make data-driven decisions to prioritize initiatives and be fast on their execution.
  • Implement solutions to our core product (both internal and external)
  • Build MVPs to validate new business opportunities

You Have

  • Analytical and data-driven mindset
  • Curious and open to challenge/ be challenged
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English
  • Ability to solve problems and make quick and effective decisions
  • Ready to engage yourself 100% in this adventure
  • You are a team player who inspires trust, are ready to take the initiative, and is distinguished by a customer-satisfaction-driven attitude;
  • You are interested in a start-up environment, you are proactive and ready to share your ideas to continue building the best product in the market

Why join us

  • Be at the forefront of scaling REVER.
  • Join a fast-growing, dynamic company with strong backing from top-tier investors.
  • Work alongside an international, passionate team in the heart of Barcelona.
  • Help shape the future of e-commerce and revolutionize the returns experience for customers around Europe.

Title: Data Analyst - Ignite
Description:
Job Description

About the role:

We are looking for a skilled and driven Data Analyst to support the EMEA Data Product Owner for Chubb‚Äôs e-trading market facing platform, Ignite. This role is instrumental in carrying out the execution of the data strategy alongside the Ignite vision. The Data Analyst will act as a vital resource in analysing data requirements, providing insights, and ensuring that data products meet the needs of business stakeholders. The successful candidate will possess strong analytical capabilities and an understanding of how data can drive decision-making within the organisation.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Insights:


Partner with business teams and the EMEA Data Product Owner to analyse requirements and identify data sources needed for analytics and reporting applications.
Conduct comprehensive data analyses to extract insights that inform product development and business strategies.
Develop, maintain, and update dashboards, reports, and other visualization tools that track key performance indicators and provide actionable insights to stakeholders.


Support For Product Management


Collaborate with the Data Product Owner to understand and document business needs, translating them into actionable specifications for data features.
Provide data-driven recommendations to improve existing products and contribute to new data product development.
Assist in managing the product backlog by prioritizing features, enhancements, and data pipelines based on business value, technical feasibility, and urgency.


Data Quality & Governance


Ensure the accuracy, consistency, and integrity of data products by implementing quality checks and identifying opportunities for process improvements.
Document data sources within the enterprise data catalogue, including metadata, lineage, and classification information, adhering to open data standards and governance policies.
Recommend solutions to enhance data quality issues identified in source systems, collaborating with data governance teams as needed.


Collaboration & Communication


Maintain effective communication with the Data Product Owner, project teams, and business stakeholders to ensure alignment on project goals and deliverables.
Report on analysis progress and present findings in a clear, concise manner to non-technical stakeholders.
Work closely with the Data Product Owner to guide the direction of analysis work, ensuring insights align with overall product objectives and business needs.


Analytics Support


Conduct ad-hoc analyses as required to support specific business initiatives or projects.
Create analytical tools and methodologies to facilitate enhanced data insights for the analytics and data science teams.
Collaborate with data engineers to optimize data pipelines for improved scalability and timely data delivery.


Requirements

QUALIFICATIONS


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in data science, Business Administration, Information Systems, or a related field.
2+ years of experience in a data analysis role, preferably in product management or analytics settings within the insurance or financial services industry.
Proficiency in data analysis tools (SQL, Python, R) and data visualization software (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Demonstrated understanding of data management principles and best practices.


Beneficial Skills


Familiarity with Agile methodologies and experience using project management tools (e.g., JIRA).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to turn complex data findings into actionable insights.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, capable of translating complex concepts for diverse audiences.
Knowledge of the insurance industry is a plus, particularly understanding underwriting, actuarial work, or operational processes.


Reporting Structure

The Data Analyst will report to EMEA Ignite Data Product Owner will work collaboratively with cross-functional teams including data engineers, business analysts, and operational teams.

What We Offer In Return


30+ days of vacation a year
2 days working from home option + additional flexible days
Working from home allowance
Entry time flexibility
Medical insurance
Life and accident insurance
Meal allowance
Pension plan
Stock Purchase plan
Flexible compensation scheme
Gympass
Employee assistance program
Comprehensive Learning & Development offer


Integrity. Client Focus. Respect. Excellence. Teamwork

Our core values dictate how we live and work. We‚Äôre an ethical and honest company that‚Äôs wholly committed to its clients. A business that‚Äôs engaged in mutual trust and respect for its employees and partners. A place where colleagues perform at the highest levels. And a working environment that‚Äôs collaborative and supportive.

Diversity & Inclusion

At Chubb, we consider our people our chief competitive advantage and as such we treat colleagues, candidates, clients, and business partners with equality, fairness and respect, regardless of their age, disability, race, religion or belief, gender, sexual orientation, marital status or family circumstances.

We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

Equal Opportunity Statement

It is our policy to provide equal employment opportunity in all of our employment practices without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, ancestry, marital status, age, individuals with disabilities, sexual orientation or gender identity or expression or any other legally protected category.

Applicants for positions with Chubb Spain must be legally authorized to work in Spain.

Title: Growth - Data & Visualization Analyst
Description:
Hi, we‚Äôre Fever

We‚Äôre excited you are checking out this job offer.

We are the leading global live-entertainment discovery tech platform with a clear mission: to democratize access to culture and entertainment.

How do we achieve our mission? Fever has developed a proprietary technology that inspires a global community of over 125M people through personalized and curated experiences in their local city whilst empowering entertainment and event creators to reach new audiences and enhance their experience.

Sounds amazing, right?

About the Team

Growth is the team responsible for promoting the Fever business plan across all Markets and ensuring that our Partners perform as expected, helping them grow within Fever.

Our decisions are data-driven from the highest to the lowest strategy level, allowing us to fully understand the Fever business model and how we can leverage this to interact with every single team within the company to grow the business in the expected direction

About the Role

We are seeking a Growth Data & Visualization Analyst with a structured mindset who is passionate about enhancing efficiency and consistently drives tasks to completion. As a key member of the W&A team, you will:


Assist in establishing new communication channels, workflows, and tools across departments under the guidance of senior analysts
Support the complete development lifecycle of these processes, ensuring timely and accurate execution
Conduct detailed audits to streamline team requirements, enhancing overall operational efficiency
Help align the organization's business needs with technological and operational solutions by managing critical tools and procedures
Engage with departments worldwide, spanning 40+ countries and diverse nationalities, to support key processes from day one


About you


You hold a bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics or Data Analytics (STEM degree)
At least 1 - 3 years experience in an analytics/strategy role
Proactive problem-solver and an opportunities-seeker with a strong willingness to learn
Strong analytical and quantitative skills as well as a strong bias towards data-based decision
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to work successfully across many disciplines departments and business cases
Familiarity with SQL or other query languages is a plus, as is proficiency in Python, JavaScript, or other programming languages
Proficiency in both written and spoken English and Spanish is a must, while knowledge of additional languages is a valuable asset


Benefits & Perks


Attractive compensation package
Have a real impact on the company's growth and evolution
Excellent working conditions with a location in the heart of the Madrid scene
Home-office friendly
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with
40% Discount on all events on Fever
Health insurance and other benefits such as Flexible remuneration with a 100% tax exemption through Cobee
English and Spanish Lessons
We have free food, drink and fruit at the office!
Possibility to receive in advance part of your salary by Payflow
Gympass Membership


Thank you for considering joining Fever. We cannot wait to learn more about you!

If you want to learn more about us: Fever's Blog | Tech.Eu |TechCrunch

Fever is committed to creating an inclusive and diverse workspace where everyone's background and ideas count. Our main goal is to find the best possible talent regardless of place of birth, racial or ethnic origin, gender, gender identity, religion, opinion, sexual orientation, disability, pregnancy, marital status, age or caring responsibilities. We encourage everyone to apply!

If you require any kind of accommodation during the selection process please contact our Talent team so we can help you by providing a welcoming and seamless journey.

If you want to know more about how Fever processes your personal data, click here Fever - Candidate Privacy Notice

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Are we the best-kept secret in M√°laga?

We like to think so. Over the past year, our M√°laga hub has grown into a thriving center of excellence, where we combine innovation, collaboration, and opportunity. We are serious about finding the right people and are confident that we have a lot to offer.


The role in a nutshell

Are you passionate about leveraging data to make meaningful business improvements? As a Business Data Analyst within the Coupa Global Reporting & Governance team, you will be instrumental in enabling datadriven decision-making and fostering continuous improvement. Your goal? To turn data insights into actionable strategies that enhance contract compliance, boost supplier performance, and streamline operational efficiency. In this role, you will collaborate closely with diverse stakeholders, acting as a vital link between business needs and technical capabilities. Your responsibilities will include gathering and validating business requirements, translating them into technical specifications, and ensuring user-friendly reporting solutions meet organizational goals. You will uphold best practices in data quality, work towards impactful reporting outcomes, and create a data-driven culture across our global Coupa landscape. With opportunities for growth in a stimulating and innovative environment, you will develop cost-saving initiatives, enhance business processes, and maintain compliance with audit requirements. If you thrive on advancing improvements through data and working in a collaborative global team, this role is your next career move!


More specifically, you will be expected to:

‚Ä¢ Analyze trends and patterns in Power BI reports to identify areas for improvement, such as contract compliance and supplier performance;

‚Ä¢ Monitor catalogue growth and drive initiatives to increase on-catalogue purchasing and reduce offcatalogue spend;

‚Ä¢ Evaluate purchasing trends to enhance contract compliance and support cost-saving strategies;

‚Ä¢ Track payment schedules to maximize early payment discounts and optimize cost efficiency;

‚Ä¢ Implement initiatives to reduce cycle times for requisitions, invoice processing, and supplier onboarding;

‚Ä¢ Advocate for electronic invoicing to improve accuracy and streamline processes;

‚Ä¢ Gather, validate, and document business requirements for reporting projects;

‚Ä¢ Support data standardization efforts to enhance reporting accuracy and consistency;

‚Ä¢ Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure reporting solutions align with strategic goals;

‚Ä¢ Develop training programs and user guides to empower end users in utilizing reports effectively


Do you have what it takes?

‚Ä¢ Skilled at interpreting data and providing actionable business insights;

‚Ä¢ Advanced skills in Power BI and Excel; SAP experience is beneficial.

‚Ä¢ Solid interpersonal and communication skills to engage with and collaborate efficiently across teams;

‚Ä¢ High accuracy and a focus on maintaining data quality in reporting outputs;

‚Ä¢ Quick to identify and address operational and technical issues;

‚Ä¢ Significant experience in increasing efficiencies and optimizing workflows;

‚Ä¢ Experience working across procurement, finance, or accounts payable functions;

‚Ä¢ Ability to develop and deliver clear training materials for diverse user groups.


Language : As you will be part of a global team, you are expected to communicate fluently in English (verbal and written). Knowledge of other languages such as French, German, or Spanish is favorable but not mandatory.


Travel: Some occasional travelling will be required.


Location: This role will ideally be based at our Malaga office, but we could consider other suitable locations


Wondering what‚Äôs in it for you?

üÜô Be part of a world class organization with a mandate to identify opportunities for improvement and drive performance benefits

üè† Hybrid Work

üí∞ Competitive compensation structure

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß‚Äçüë¶ Health Insurance coverage for you and your dependents

üõü Life Insurance

üìà Growth Opportunities (career progression, tuition assistance, language courses, training and certifications, etc.)

üõ¨ Relocation assistance


If you are ready to join our diverse team, make a difference and advance your career in a global setting, we want to hear from you.

Join us and help shape the future of data-driven procurement and finance processes! Given the global nature of the role, we ask applicants to submit their resume in English and indicate their working rights status.

Glencore encourages diversity and provides an inclusive workplace.

Accommodations are available upon request for applicants with special needs.

Interviews may start prior to the closing date.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Gopuff, we‚Äôre not just delivering convenience‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we‚Äôve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

Now, we‚Äôre building something even bigger. We‚Äôre establishing a core hub in Lisbon, Portugal and we‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst, you‚Äôll own the transformation of raw data into game-changing insights, fuelling the decisions that drive our business forward.

You‚Äôll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo and make high-impact recommendations that influence company-wide KPIs. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won‚Äôt just support decisions‚Äîyou‚Äôll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance‚Äîjust a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you‚Äôre a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let‚Äôs go. üöÄ

You Will:


Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation to drive business efficiency, optimise cost-effectiveness, and elevate customer satisfaction.
Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to deliver transparency and clarity into core business performance metrics, ensuring alignment with strategic KPIs.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams‚Äîincluding Category Management, Growth, and Finance‚Äîto translate data insights into actionable strategies that improve processes and drive measurable outcomes.
Conduct deep dives into company performance to identify areas for improvement, uncover opportunities for efficiency, and ensure KPIs align with overarching business objectives.
Solve complex, real-world challenges by leveraging data to deliver practical solutions that enhance operational excellence and fuel company growth.
Present data insights in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are informed by robust analysis.


You Have:


Proven Data Analytics Expertise: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in data analytics, ideally in a fast-paced, high-growth e-commerce or retail environment, where you‚Äôve delivered impactful insights that drive business success.
Fluency in English: Exceptional communication skills in English, enabling you to effectively collaborate with global teams and present complex data insights to diverse audiences.
Outstanding Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, Looker, and dbt, with a proven track record of querying large datasets, building complex reports, and developing scalable data models that empower decision-making.
Mastery of Data Visualisation and Reporting Tools: Deep familiarity with tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a talent for transforming raw data into strategic insights and actionable recommendations.
Analytical Problem-Solver: A natural problem-solver with a passion for tackling complex business challenges, identifying opportunities for improvement, and delivering innovative, data-driven solutions.
High-Performing and Self-Motivated: A self-starter who thrives in dynamic environments, consistently pushing boundaries to deliver excellence and make a tangible impact on the business.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including leadership.


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it‚Äîstuff happens. But that‚Äôs where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we‚Äôre assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you‚Äôre hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Global Client Analytics, Quantitative Data Intelligence, Python, SQL, GIT, Optimization

Your Main Activities Are


To be part of an international and diverse team who helps Global Markets Front Office to get to know their clients better and identify opportunities and trends throught what data can tell
As a Data Analyst, you will play a vital role in our team. Working directly with one or more of the bank's business areas, you will provide valuable insights to drive business growth, understading their needs, proposing and implementing data-driven solutions (analysis, visualization and automation). You will exercise a lot of problem identification and problem solving skills
You will have the opportunity to take ownership of business essential analytical projects that involve retrieving, preparing and analysing complex datasets using data/statistical models and best practices in data visualization for the reporting creation, with the goal to produce insights and automated tools that will guide strategic solutions
You will move between technical and non-technical areas and should be able to communicate well with different types of professionals. It is very important to be able to clearly and concisely understand stekeholders‚Äô needs and translate these to our technical team, as well as present the results of complex analysis to our stakeholders
You must be prepared for routine changes, each day will be filled with new and excited challenges


Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Economics, Computing, Mathematics, Statistics or related fields
Availability to work in the hybrid model or in person in the Lisbon or Porto office
Professional experience in any data visualization tool such as Tableau or Power BI
Professional experience in data analysis with programming, preferably Python (Pandas)
Proficiency in SQL
Fluency in written and spoken English
Ability to analyze, synthetize and simplify.
Knowledge of descriptive statistics and hypothesis testing is a plus.
Knowledge in Big Data technology such as Pyspark, Presto and Airflow is a plus
Knowledge of Power Query and DAX is a plus


About The Team


The Quantitative Data Intelligence (QDI) team is responsible for providing data, insights, and analysis to Global Markets front office.
The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • The team aims to build a solid database from various sources and develop analysis, reports and dashboards to provide valuable insight to the Front Office in a rapid, agile manner.
  • Our team is responsible for multiple steps regarding data processing: Data Feeds industrialization, ETL, Data Warehousing and Data Visualization. We are in direct contact with business sponsors, sales, and traders.
  • We seek to shape the technologies available to the client‚Äôs needs - we plan in processing the data using Python and SQL, while delivering the final product in Tableau, Power BI, APIs, and Chat bots.

Why joining BNP Paribas?

  • Leading banking institution

BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.

  • Our presence in Portugal

In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.

  • International reach

Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions

  • Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
  • Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
  • Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
  • Diversity and Inclusion commitment

BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.

  • Commitment towards work/life balance

At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.

  • Remote Working Conditions

At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, e-commerce, Digital, Data Analytics, Business Support

Your Main Activities Are


Academic background in Finance, Economics, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar areas
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Fluency in English


Excellent communication skills and client focus


Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Creativity and innovation mind set
Strong analytical and problem solving skills
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Python and other IT coding Skills ‚Äì (Intermediate)


Profile And Skills To Success

I. FX+ Service management :


Coordinate BAU relationship with main FX+ subscribers, maintain good relationship with the key stakeholders of each subscriber, ensure subscriber satisfaction through periodical service review meetings, in close collaboration with IT teams.
Produce quality documentation: processes, agreements, reports, presentations.


II. Quality Management And Support


Act as business level 2 hands on support on production issues escalated by level 1 IT support teams, in close collaboration where necessary with Transaction Banking support teams.
Incident analysis / prevention / Remediation: learn from past incidents, design and implement new proactive control processes to secure that products, act as business coordinator and E2E responsible for analysis and execution of incident remediation
Quality Reporting: develop and publish quality KPI for FX+ activity: Level of digitalisation /automation, FX request negative responses, response times.
Business Monitoring & BAU Risk analysis: Implement and run business monitoring tools and processes to secure FX+ margins are calculated as expected


III. BAU - Distribution Support


Act as FX+ subject matter expert /SPOC for FX+, FXLM and Cash Management sales and implementation teams for all questions related to FX+. Participate in commercial governance
Work with FXLM and Cash Management Sales and implementation teams to onboard new clients and implement price changes to specific populations of clients (RFPs), on specific products, in specific territories


About The Team

The FX Payments activity is a key area of growth for Global Markets. In order to support and accelerate that growth an electronic platform (FX+) has been designed. FX+ is delivering automated FX solutions to support other BNPP business lines such as Cash Management, Trade Finance, Correspondent Banking, who require FX to deliver transactional services to their clients.


FX+ Payments is a platform that manages the execution of FX within International Payments


(i.e. Payment + FX in one transaction)


FX+ is successfully implemented in ca 40 countries across Europe, MEA, APAC and North America ; it is globally generating a very significant stream of revenues for BNP Paribas
FX+ aims to strengthen the BNPP FX electronic offer: Enrich the transaction banking offer (pricing flexibility, extend currency coverage ‚Ä¶) with a better FX execution (transparency, automation of processes, 24/7 service, ...)
Within this context, FX+ drives the cross selling with new Business lines (Cash Management, Trade or Supply Chain) and Third parties (Retailers, Payment Service Providers‚Ä¶) through a complete and integrated FX+ Product suite, involving innovative Open Banking API solutions.


Why joining BNP Paribas?

Title: Product Analyst (Data team)
Description:
About us:

Planner 5D is a global hub for home design, uniting over 100+ million users in 230 territories around our planet (yes, we have 2 users connecting from Antarctica each month!). Our platform simplifies the home renovation process from concept to execution, and this process has never been more straightforward with our cutting-edge software. You don't need to be a professional designer to enhance your home or workspace. We are dedicated to streamlining the design experience, making the customization of dream homes accessible to everyone.

Our cross-platform presence spans Web, iOS, Android, Windows, and MacOS, ensuring seamless synchronization for our users. Planner 5D is more than just software; it's a vibrant community of enthusiastic and product-oriented professionals. From diverse backgrounds, our team collaborates across time zones, fueled by a shared passion to revolutionize the home design market.

We are constantly looking for like-minded talent eager to take ownership and drive innovation within our expanding suite of tools. Join us in shaping the future of home design.

The Senior Product Analyst will play a critical role in driving data-informed decision-making and product optimization.

Key responsibilities include:


Tracking Events Design and Specification: Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design and specify tracking events that capture user behavior and product interactions
Tracking Events Delivery and Quality Management: Ensure accurate and timely delivery of tracking events and maintain high data quality standards
Definitions of Features and Connected Tracking Events: Clearly define product features and their associated tracking events to enable comprehensive analysis
Product and Feature Usage Metrics and KPIs: Develop and monitor key metrics and KPIs to measure product and feature performance
Framework for Feature Usage Analysis and Insights: Create a framework for analyzing feature usage and generating actionable insights
Overall Product Growth Metrics and Analysis: Track and analyze overall product growth metrics to identify trends and opportunities
A/B Test Framework for Continuous Improvements: Implement and manage an A/B testing framework to facilitate data-driven experimentation and optimization
Hypothesis and Experiments Documentation, Delivery, and Analysis: Document hypotheses, design and execute experiments, and analyze results to validate assumptions and inform product decisions
Conduct Quantitative and Qualitative Product Research: Utilize both quantitative and qualitative research methods to gain a deep understanding of user needs and behaviors
Use AI Tools and Approaches for Product Analysis: Leverage AI tools and techniques to enhance product analysis and uncover valuable insights



Qualifications:


Strong Analytical Skills: Proven ability to collect, analyze, and interpret complex data sets
Product Development Knowledge: Familiarity with product development processes and methodologies
Technical Proficiency: Experience with data analysis tools such as BigQuery, Looker Data Studio, and product analytics platforms like Amplitude, Devtodev, Mixpanel, or other modern tools and frameworks
AI and Machine Learning Experience: Knowledge of AI and machine learning techniques and their application in product analysis
Communication and Collaboration: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams
Problem-Solving and Critical Thinking: Strong problem-solving and critical thinking skills, with a data-driven approach to decision-making
Education: Bachelor's or Master's degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering) or equivalent experience



Key Skills:


Data Analysis
Product Analytics
SQL
BigQuery
Looker Data Studio
A/B Testing
Experimentation
AI and Machine Learning
Communication
Collaboration
Problem-Solving



Additional Skills:


Knowledge of data visualization tools
Statistical modeling expertise



What we offer:


Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
Company computer equipment by request
Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
English classes on our corporate platform
Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions

  • Knowledge of data visualization tools
  • Statistical modeling expertise


What we offer:

  • Great work environment that balances freedom and responsibility
  • Our team is made up of friendly and passionate enthusiasts who are eager to help and share their knowledge
  • We believe in work-life balance, so you'll receive around 30+ days of paid holidays per year
  • Company computer equipment by request
  • Education courses for our team members, and we're willing to allocate funds toward your training expenses
  • English classes on our corporate platform
  • Offline company events in Lithuania and online team-building
  • Unlimited free Planner5D subscriptions

Country: Portugal

We are looking for an experienced and data-driven Product Data Analyst to join our Digital Channels team. This role focuses on leveraging data to inform and optimize product decisions, ensuring our web and app platforms deliver outstanding customer experiences. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and a strong analytical background, helping the team with product discovery, business case development, A/B testing, and the continuous monitoring of key features through dashboards and reporting tools.

Principais Responsabilidades


User interaction Analysis: Analyze web and app usage data to uncover trends, user behavior, and opportunities for product improvement.
Product Discovery Support: Collaborate with Product Managers during the discovery phase by providing insights from data to identify customer needs and validate opportunities.
Business Case Development: Contribute to the development of business cases by providing data-driven insights and projections to evaluate potential product initiatives.
Success Metrics Definition: Partner with stakeholders to define and track key success metrics for new features and initiatives, ensuring alignment with business objectives.
A/B Testing: Design, execute, and analyze A/B tests to validate hypotheses, measure impact, and optimize product performance.
Dashboard Creation: Develop and maintain dashboards for continuous monitoring of key features, ensuring stakeholders have real-time insights into performance.
Cross-Functional Collaboration: Work closely with Product Managers, Engineers, Designers, and Marketing teams to ensure data-driven decision-making throughout the product lifecycle.
Tool Optimization: Act as a subject matter expert in Google Analytics 4, ensuring best practices are followed and providing training or guidance to team members as needed.


Requisitos


Experience: 2-5 years of experience in data analysis, preferably within a fintech, digital product, or SaaS environment.
Analytics Expertise: Strong hands-on experience with Google Analytics 4 (GA4) and familiarity with other analytics tools (e.g., Tableau, Looker, Power BI).
Technical Skills: Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Python or R for data analysis is a plus.
Data Storytelling: Ability to transform complex data into clear, actionable insights and present findings effectively to stakeholders.
Problem-Solving: Strong analytical mindset with a focus on solving complex problems using data.
A/B Testing: Experience designing and interpreting A/B tests to evaluate product hypotheses and feature performance.
Collaboration Skills: Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with experience working in cross-functional teams.
Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in a STEM field (Science, Technology, Engineering, Mathematics), Economics, Marketing, Business or a related discipline.

Title: Trainee Data Analyst (Career Accelerator with Employment Guarantee)
Description:
Are you passionate about uncovering insights from data and driving informed decision-making? Are you looking for a structured training program that can kickstart your career in data analysis?

At Nuyew Tech Academy, we specialise in providing aspiring tech professionals like you with the tools, training, and support needed to launch successful careers in this vital industry.

Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to advance your existing skills, our academy offers a comprehensive program designed to cultivate your talent and propel you towards exciting opportunities in data analysis.

What the Data Analysis Career Accelerator at Nuyew Tech Academy includes and what students can expect:


Comprehensive Training: Receive in-depth training in data analysis tools and techniques, including Excel, Databases, Python, Power BI and AI.
Hands-on Experience: Opportunities to gain practical experience through real-world scenarios and virtual labs.
Industry-Recognised Certifications: Preparation for industry-recognised certifications such as CompTIA Data+, Microsoft Power BI Associate and Microsoft Excel Expert to validate skills and enhance employability.
Personalised Support: Dedicated student support team offering guidance, feedback, and support throughout the program to ensure student success.
Career Development: Tailored career guidance, resume building, interview preparation, and job search assistance to help students transition into data analyst roles.
Networking Opportunities: Access to networking events and alumni connections to expand professional networks and explore career opportunities.
Financial Support: Scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans available to make the program accessible and affordable for all aspiring data analyst professionals.


Requirements


No previous experience or qualifications required
Strong interest in tech and data analysis
Ability to work independently and in a team environment
Detail-oriented and strong attention to accuracy and completeness
Willingness to learn and continuously improve technical and professional skills


Benefits


Career Advancement: Elevate your professional journey with a tailored training course that's designed to set you on the path towards high-demand tech roles.
Competitive Salary Prospects: Upon completing our training and gaining some relevant experience, candidates are poised to secure roles with salaries aligned to what's advertised on the job listing. Invest in your future potential!
Employment Guarantee: If you haven't secured a tech job by course completion, we'll provide additional training and career support until you do. Still not employed after three years? We'll refund your tuition in full, and you keep your certifications. Your future in tech starts with us.
Professional Growth: Broaden your horizons and skill set with diverse professional development opportunities throughout and post-training.
Dynamic Learning Environment: Experience a vibrant and supportive academy atmosphere where innovation meets education.
Affordable Learning: We're committed to making education accessible. The academy career pathway tuition fee of ¬£3995 can be funded by scholarship opportunities and interest free student loans which enable you to spread your tuition fee over 36 months.


Please Note: While we offer robust training and support to help candidates find employment, it's important to clarify that candidates will not be directly employed by Nuyew Tech Academy. Our commitment is to empower you with the skills and support needed to enhance your job prospects in the broader tech industry.

Whether you're starting from scratch or looking to advance your existing skills, our academy offers a comprehensive program designed to cultivate your talent and propel you towards exciting opportunities in data analysis.

Title: Business Data Analyst
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Responsibilities

  • Main responsible for Business requirement gathering, User Story writing, and leading User Story refinement / Solution design efforts within the team. Able to build small prototypes and mock-ups as part of refinement efforts.
  • Work together with Stakeholders during the Acceptance stage of solutions to guarantee successful delivery.
  • Proactively capture and understand Business processes and suggest improvements to the Data Platform that benefit the organization.

Essential Skills

  • At least 5 years' experience in a similar role;
  • Proven experience with data projects related to accounting, planning and financial analysis domains;
  • Solid knowledge of data analysis and programming with SQL and Python;
  • Good knowledge of understanding REST/API SOAP APIs;
  • Good ability to create prototypes to support requirements in Power BI;
  • Good knowledge of English.

Title: Financial Data Analyst
Description:
What do we do?

Paddle offers digital product companies a completely different approach to their payment infrastructure. Instead of assembling and maintaining a complex stack of payments-related apps and services, we‚Äôre a Merchant of Record for our customers. That means we take away 100% of the pain of payment fragmentation. It‚Äôs faster, safer, cheaper, and, above all, way better.

We‚Äôre backed by investors including KKR, FTV Capital, Kindred, Notion, and 83North and serve over 5000 software sellers in 245 territories globally.

The Role:

Working closely with Paddle‚Äôs finance team, the core of the role will be supporting the Finance Operations Manager in making sure all financial data is accurate and available in real time.

As Paddle is scaling we‚Äôre constantly developing and delivering new products for our customers, as well rapidly growing the number of transactions through our platform each month globally. In order to maintain high standards in financial reporting, these changes in products and increase in transactions must be monitored closely, and the reporting accurately reflected.

The Analyst will be responsible for creating, maintaining, and improving a series of reports across accounting, tax and treasury, as well as supporting the team through annual audits, and providing data analysis and insight for key stakeholders within the company. They will be able to utilise our data stack and work with our Data Engineering team to ensure the Finance team‚Äôs needs are met and the quality of, and access to, our reporting is high.

The role will be fast paced and can include changing priorities due to the team‚Äôs needs.

What you'll do:


Work closely with the Finance teams to produce and maintain a series of key reports needed for Paddle‚Äôs financial reporting
Work on scoped briefs under the guidance of the Finance Operations Manager and other Finance Managers
Be able to build, and work with Data Engineering to build out the reporting infrastructure across our BI tools and data stack
Become a subject matter expert on Paddle financial data, and the tools we use.
Contribute to strategic planning by recognising areas of weakness or upcoming change, and efficiency improvements in our reporting across:
Global tax filings
Month end reporting across sales and revenue
Continually evolve our data collection, processing and reporting structures through scoping new tools and methods to help the Finance team support the wider business


We'd love to hear from you:


You have strong commercial experience in relational database structures, SQL, and Excel.
Experience with Pigment is a plus.
Working knowledge of Dbt and Snowflake is a plus.
You have experience working within a financial organisation or with finance teams
You have experience working with large data sets
You‚Äôre a great problem solver
You have strong data visualisation and presentation techniques.
You have exposure to BI and ETL tools, such as Sisense, Looker, Tableau and PowerBI.
Have experience in working for start ups / scale ups, or financial organisations, and can work in an unstructured environment


Everyone is welcome at Paddle

At Paddle, we‚Äôre committed to removing invisible barriers, both for our customers and within our own teams. We recognise and celebrate that every Paddler is unique and we welcome every individual perspective. As an inclusive employer, we don‚Äôt care if, or where, you studied, what you look like or where you‚Äôre from. We‚Äôre more interested in your craft, curiosity, passion for learning and what you‚Äôll add to our culture. We encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt match every part of the job ad, especially if you‚Äôre part of an underrepresented group.

Please let us know if there‚Äôs anything we can do to better support you through the application process and in the workplace. We will do everything we can to support any accommodations needed. We‚Äôre committed to building a diverse team where everyone feels safe to be their authentic self. Let‚Äôs grow together.

Why you‚Äôll love working at Paddle

We are a diverse, growing group of Paddlers across the globe who pride ourselves on our transparent, collaborative and respectful culture.

We live and breathe our values, which are:

Paddle For Others

Paddle together

Paddle simply

We offer a full suite of benefits, including attractive salaries, stock options, retirement plans, private healthcare and well-being initiatives.

We are a ‚Äòdigital-first‚Äô company, which means you can work remotely, from one of our stylish hubs, or even a bit of both! We offer all team members unlimited holidays and enhanced parental leave. We invest in learning and will help you with your personal development via constant exposure to new challenges, an annual learning fund, and regular internal and external training.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
Keywords: Capital Markets, Risk Management, Trading Risk, Equities, Fixed Income, Currencies and Commodities, Data Analytics

About The Job

The Financial Resources Analytics is accountable for delivering excellence in all trading risk strategy activities we lead or oversee. This includes ensuring that these activities align with the Bank's objectives, client goals, approved risk appetites, and strategic priorities.

Your Main Activities Are


Assess and challenge the allocation and management of Risk and Resources (R&R) by the Business Lines (FICC) to ensure a strategic optimization of returns
Analyse Risk measures linked to capital consumption of Bank activities and ensure that return is optimised for capital allocation
Comply with all legal and regulatory requirements, and anticipate/ plan future regulatory changes, in relation to R&R management and capital allocation
Propose and implement solutions to facilitate new trades when BNPP‚Äôs risk appetite is reached
Identify and suggest innovative ideas to improve the Bank‚Äôs risk processes and reduce inaccuracies
Understand and monitor the main characteristics and concentrations of the risk portfolio managed by the team
Prepare periodic and ad-hoc reports on individual counterparties, sectors and/ or country crisis
Contribute to the reporting of the main risks and stress-tests across Global Markets
Maintain, improve and develop a toolbox for efficient risk management


Profile And Skills To Success


Master‚Äôs in Finance, Economics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Financial Mathematics or Engineering
Interest in Financial Markets
Expertise with data analysis‚Äì Python, VBA and SQL (Strongly referred)
Ability to provide clear and concise analysis
Process oriented with a problem-solving mindset
Curiosity, Attention to detail and Autonomy
Ability to communicate clearly ‚Äì both oral and written forms
Fluency in English
Structured, methodical and organized approach to work


About The Team

The Global Equities and Fixed Income Currencies and Commodities (FICC) Trading Risk Strategy (TRS) Team is responsible for managing trading positions' risk and returns. To achieve this, we oversee the daily production of key position reports and stress tests for trading desks, as well as a weekly in-depth review of positions and Profit/ Loss (P&L) performance. Additionally, we participate in ad-hoc studies and deep dives to assess specific portfolio risks and expected returns, upon request.

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centers providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Applied Behavioural Analyst
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products ‚Äî including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more ‚Äî help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‚Äå 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work‚Ñ¢. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Behavioural Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else ‚Äî with innovation, logical thinking, and lots of style. We take the most complex problems in behavioural science and build tailor-made solutions that create beneficial outcomes.

We start with deep data analysis to understand our employees, their objectives, and any issues they might have. Then, we use quantitative and qualitative research, statistics, and advanced machine learning algorithms to deliver the best possible results for Revolut and Revoluters. We experiment, iterate, and build empirically-sound, science-backed solutions using the most advanced methods and techniques.

We‚Äôre looking for a next-level Behavioural Analyst to help shape the future of our high-growth, high-performance culture. You‚Äôll be working alongside the best in behavioural science, data science, engineering, and human resources on impactful projects that‚Äôll move our company forward.

Up for the challenge? Let's get in touch.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Leading and supporting the development of innovative and scientific strategies for people research, pre-employment assessment, employee listening, and recruitment
Collaborating with the Talent team on initiatives that increase performance and reduce attrition, while driving employee engagement, wellbeing, and job satisfaction
Delivering real impact to Revolut‚Äôs culture in collaboration with the Culture Lab
Developing data-driven solutions that double down on Revolut‚Äôs commitment to diversity and inclusion


What You'll Need


3‚Äì5 years of experience in applied behavioural science, people science, or similar
Great skills with Python or R, plus intermediate SQL skills
Experience with psychometric or behavioural data in applied, actionable forms
Experience working with pre-employment and behavioural data at scale
End-to-end experience with all aspects of research (study design, execution, analysis, and reporting)


Nice to have


Advanced statistics and quantitative research skills (t-tests, ANOVA, EFA/CFA/PCA, linear and logistic regression, RWA, etc.)
Experience with employee listening/engagement surveys
Experience with forecasting and machine learning models, such as K-Means, XGBoost, KNN, Random Forests, and ARIMA


Building a global financial super app isn‚Äôt enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that‚Äôs why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

We‚Äôre doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That‚Äôs why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: BDO Static Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job


The BDO Static Data Analyst‚Äôs mission is to be responsible for the setup and maintenance of client database and ISIN database, in order to allow the integration of order received by the client. It is also a 1st level control for the trades monitoring and correcting any trade with errors

Your Main Activities Are


Ensure Integration and maintenance of clients‚Äô database (either manually or through support to the upload function)
Monitor error queues and trade recycling on a real time basis
Manage the Securities shared database
Mitigate risk exposure through a proper follow-up of procedures and alert/escalation mechanisms
Keep the Team Leader informed about the clients‚Äô activity and escalate issues whenever appropriate
Keep the procedures update
Ensure execution of tasks and complete checklist

Profile and Skills to Success


Bachelor Degree in Economics / Finance / Accounting or related
Up to 2 years of experience in Banking and Financial Operations or similar
Advanced level of English, both written and oral
Knowledge in MS Office Pack (Excel, PowerPoint)
Attention to detail / rigor
Ability to collaborate / teamwork
Ability to share / pass on knowledge
Communication skills, both written and oral
Client focused

Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.
