Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Are you ready to revolutionise the world with TEKEVER? üöÄüåç

Join us, the European leader in unmanned technology, where cutting-edge advancements meet unparalleled innovation. We offer a unique surveillance-as-a-service solution that provides real-time intelligence, enhancing maritime safety and saving lives. TEKEVER is setting new standards in intelligence services, data and AI technologies.

Become part of a dynamic team transforming maritime surveillance and making a significant impact on global safety. üåê

At TEKEVER, our mission is to provide limitless support through mission-oriented game-changers, delivering the right information at the right time to facilitate critical decisions.

If you‚Äôre passionate about technology and eager to shape the future, TEKEVER is the place for you! üëáüèªüéØ

Job Overview

As a Data Engineer, you will play a critical role in designing, building and maintaining the data pipelines and systems that support our data-driven initiatives, as well as supporting the evolution of our Data & Analytics Platform. You will work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to ensure that our data & AI infrastructure is robust, scalable and efficient. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data engineering, with experience in data integration, ETL processes, database management and Data & Analytics Platform development.

What Will Be Your Responsibilities


Data Pipeline Development: Design, develop and maintain scalable and efficient data pipelines to collect, process and store large volumes of data from various sources.
ETL Processes: Implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes to ensure data is accurately and efficiently transformed and loaded into data storage systems.
Database Management: Manage and optimize databases and data warehouses to ensure data integrity, performance and availability.
Data Integration: Integrate data from multiple sources, including APIs, databases and external data providers, to create unified datasets for analysis.
Data & Analytics Platform development & expansion: support the expansion of our Data & Analytics Platform.
Data Quality Assurance: Implement data validation and quality assurance processes to ensure the accuracy and consistency of data.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide the necessary data infrastructure and support.
Performance Optimization: Monitor and optimize the performance of data pipelines and databases to ensure efficient data processing and retrieval.
Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of data pipelines, ETL processes and database schemas.


Profile And Requirements


Education: Bachelors or Masters degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Systems, or a related field.
Experience: 3+ years of experience in data engineering or a similar role.
Technical Skills:
Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, Java, or Scala.
Experience with SQL and database management systems (e.g., MySQL, PostgreSQL, SQL Server).
Familiarity with big data technologies (e.g., Hadoop, Spark) and data warehousing solutions (e.g., Redshift, Snowflake).
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and their data services, with a focus on Google Cloud. Google Cloud certification is preferred.
Knowledge of data integration tools and frameworks (e.g., Apache Nifi, Talend, Informatica).
Experience with data modeling and schema design.
Experience with Iaac (e.g. Ansible, Terraform), data pipeline orchestration (e.g. Airflow), log exploration tools (e.g. Streamlit, Dash), data extraction (e.g. PostGIS, Kafka, Airflow, FastAPI), pandas, scikit-learn, Docker.
Basic understanding of DevOps best practices and tools: GIT, CI/CD, telemetry and monitoring, etc.
Analytical Skills: Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on delivering scalable and efficient data solutions.
Communication: Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Attention to Detail: High attention to detail and a commitment to ensuring data quality and accuracy.
Adaptability: Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities simultaneously.

What We Have To Offer You


An excellent work environment and an opportunity to create a real impact in the world;
A truly high-tech, state-of-the-art engineering company with flat structure and no politics;
Working with the very latest technologies in Data & AI, including Edge AI, Swarming - both within our software platforms and within our embedded on-board systems;
Flexible work arrangements;
Professional development opportunities;
Collaborative and inclusive work environment;
Salary compatible with the level of proven experience.


Do you want to know more about us ?

Visit our LinkedIn page at https://www.linkedin.com/company/tekever/

Title: Head of Business Intelligence, Poker
Description:
Title: Head of Business Intelligence

Department: Data

Location: Europe, Remote

About Block Labs

Block Labs is a leading force in the Web3 space, incubating, investing in, and accelerating top-tier fintech, crypto and iGaming projects. With a mission to shape the future of decentralized technology, we partner with visionary startups to raise funding, refine product-market fit, and grow their audiences.

As we continue to grow we are now looking for an ambitious and self-driven Head of Business Intelligence to join our rapidly growing team!

About The Role

We are seeking an experienced and strategic leader to shape the way we see crypto poker. As the Head of Business Intelligence, you will drive the organization‚Äôs data strategy, transforming data into actionable insights to support key business decisions. This role involves optimizing data processes, and leveraging advanced analytics to identify growth opportunities, improve operational efficiency, and enhance overall performance. If you thrive in a data-driven environment and are passionate about influencing business success through analytics, this is the role for you.

Key Responsibilities

Data Analysis and Reporting:


Analyse large datasets to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Develop and maintain BI dashboards and reports to support business decision-making
Provide actionable insights and recommendations based on data analysis


Poker-Specific Insights


Utilise your poker experience to analyse game performance and player behaviour
Assess the impact of game features, promotions, and marketing campaigns on player engagement and revenue
Identify opportunities for optimising game mechanics and user experience and revenue
Conduct competitive analysis to benchmark against industry standards and identify growth opportunities


Data Management


Ensure data integrity and accuracy by implementing best practices in data collection and analysis
Work with Product and data teams to optimise data storage and retrieval processes


Communication


Present findings and insights to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner
Translate complex data into understandable and actionable business terms
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to support initiatives with data-driven insights


Highly Desired Knowledge And Experience


Experience in Poker: Experience in the gaming industry is highly desirable, preferably poker


About You


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or a related field.Advanced degree (Master‚Äôs or Ph.D.) is a plus
Proven experience as a BI Analyst or similar role
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, Node JS , or similar
Experience with BI tools like Tableau, Power BI, Amplitude, SingularLooker, or similar
Strong understanding of data warehousing and ETL processes
Knowledge of crypto would be beneficial
Experience in the gaming industry is highly desirable; Poker and Casino

Title: Business Analyst (BI)
Description:
Main Tasks And Responsibilities

Noesis is looking for candidates with the following profile:


Analyze and document business requirements for BI projects.
Design and develop BI data models.
Provide training and support to BI tool users


Requirements


Degree in Management Information Systems or similar;
Minimum of 5 years as a Business Analyst (preferably in projects BI);
Knowledge of basic BI modeling concepts (Star Schema and/or snowflake);
Knowledge of ETL;
Experience in data modeling and SQL.
Excellent communication skills.
Dynamism, proactivity and ability to work in a team;


If you meet these conditions and would like to join an innovative organization that continuously invests in training its talents, send us your application.

All our recruitment and selection processes are based on equal opportunities, valuing the competence and potential of each person and ensuring that no candidate is discriminated on the grounds of gender, ethnicity, sexual orientation, age, religion or physical condition.

Title: Data Visualization Engineer
Description:
Liminal is a global market intelligence and strategic advisory firm specializing in digital identity, financial crime and compliance, and IT security technology solutions across industries while also catering to the private equity and venture capital community. Founded in 2016, Liminal offers strategic and analytical services supporting executive decision-making at all product and business lifecycle stages. We advise some of the world‚Äôs most prominent business leaders, investors, and policymakers on building, acquiring, and investing in the next generation of solutions and technologies. We provide access to proprietary data and analysis, strategic frameworks, and integrated insights on the industry‚Äôs only market intelligence platform.

Every major company in the world has started focusing on the next generation of digital identity technologies as a necessity for continued growth and security. Our team works with a myriad of organizations, from Fortune 100s to startups, across industries including financial services, technology, telecommunications, and the P2P economy. At Liminal, we help businesses build solutions, execute strategies, invest intelligently, and connect with key decision-makers. We know that it‚Äôs in the sharing of discovery and insights that groundwork is laid, problems are solved, and entire sectors advance at the speed of light. Keeping information to ourselves delays progress for all. At Liminal, we don't just respond to the market; we define it.

About The Role

We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Visualization Engineer to join our team and elevate the way users interact with data on Link, our web-based actionable intelligence platform. In this role, you will design and develop intuitive, interactive, and impactful data visualizations that transform complex information into actionable insights. Collaborating closely with product managers, designers, and engineers, you will play a critical role in creating a seamless and engaging user experience. Your expertise in React development and data visualization techniques will be key to delivering meaningful visualizations that drive value for our users.

What You'll Do

Data Visualization Design


Design and implement user-friendly data visualizations that effectively communicate complex information.
Develop interactive charts, graphs, and dashboards using React and modern visualization libraries (e.g., D3.js, Recharts, Chart.js).
Ensure data visualizations are responsive, accessible, and consistent with the platform's design system.
Translate user requirements into intuitive visual representation strategies, optimizing usability and engagement.


Prototyping and Testing


Create and iterate on prototypes to visualize design concepts and gather feedback from stakeholders.
Conduct usability testing to ensure visualizations meet user needs and identify opportunities for improvement.
Use analytics and user feedback to refine and enhance existing visualizations.


Collaboration and Implementation


Work closely with product managers and UX designers to align visualization designs with user and business goals.
Collaborate with front-end engineers to ensure seamless integration and performance optimization of visualizations.
Maintain and improve a reusable visualization component library for consistent implementation across the platform.


Continuous Learning and Development


Stay updated on the latest trends, tools, and best practices in data visualization, React development, and UI/UX design.
Share knowledge and insights with the team to drive innovation and improvement.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science, Design, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data visualization development, preferably for web-based or SaaS platforms.
Proficiency in React and related tools/libraries.
Experience with data visualization libraries such as D3.js, Recharts, or Chart.js.
Experience with data BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Strong understanding of data visualization principles and the ability to craft visualizations that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing.
Familiarity with responsive design, accessibility standards, and cross-browser compatibility.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate in a cross-functional team environment.
Show more

  • Strong understanding of data visualization principles and the ability to craft visualizations that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing.
  • Familiarity with responsive design, accessibility standards, and cross-browser compatibility.
  • Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate in a cross-functional team environment.

Title: Senior Data Analyst for Risk Anticipation
Description:
Present in more than 30 countries, BNP Paribas Personal Finance leads the personal and consumer credit business. In some markets we are leaders, and we bet on innovation to open up new opportunities, in others we are a fast growing business. In all markets, we value relationships, knowledge sharing and responsible action.

We are committed to promoting access to more responsible and sustainable consumption to support our customers and partners. To achieve this, we implement concrete actions, not only in the way we develop our business and enhance our sustainable growth, with the ambition to reduce our environmental footprint, but also in the way we support those who need it most.

BNPP Personal Finance is, by nature, exposed to Fraud, and relies heavily on quantitative models and strong analytics to manage it. Each day, millions of credit granting decisions are made, using hundreds of decision rules and models. The importance and complexity of these ecosystems at use within BNPP-PF keep on rising as the digital transformation accelerates.

In practice, your day-to-day


Risk Anticipation team is in charge of the IFRS9 provisioning calculation methodology and must ensure that the method is properly applied throughout the BNP Paribas Personal Finance perimeter.
The main role of the Risk Anticipation analyst is to ensure the correct level of provisioning for BNPP PF outstandings, and to ensure the correct application of the IFRS9 provisioning methodology throughout the scope of Personal Finance.
He is the direct international contact point for the local Risk teams.
The Risk Anticipation team is mainly located in Paris, and we are opening a new position in Lisbon.
The main activities will be:
Simulation of application of provisioning method on BNPP PF portfolios.
Developing mathematical language program models in SAS and Python.
Analyze the level of Risk of BNPP Portfolios through data at customer level.
Daily exchange with your colleagues in Paris.

The Mission is important, but so is the Team and the workplace!


Within BNP Paribas Personal Finance, Central Risk Department is responsible for the relevance of risk rating models used within all local entities and for maintaining a high level of expertise with integrating new statistical techniques in new modelling environments.
You will operate in a friendly and international work environment, designed to make the collaborating experience as pleasant as possible!
You will have regular exchanges with the Central (this will help to build up competence based on different cultures and levels of responsibility).
You will participate to projects and strategics activities, part of the Strategic Plan of BNPP PF.
The Risk Anticipation team is mainly located in Paris, you will be located in Lisbon and you will join the Credit Risk Optimization team in Lisbon and working on Risk Anticipation topics.


What do we have to offer you?


This is a very important topic that we will address together, taking into account your training and experience.


Are you the one we are looking for?


Have you a few experiences in Credit Risk Management, with mathematical/statistical background and a few years of successful experience, preference in a Bank, a financial environment, or a digital business?
Do you know Python or other database language (SAS, SQL)?
Do you have knowledge about IFRS9 norms standards? Or about IRB models (PD, EaD, LGD)?
Are you able to work on several projects at the same time and are known for your rigor?
Are you comfortable communicating orally and in writing with different interlocutors and sharing information?
Are you doing everything you can to achieve your goals?
Do you have a good knowledge in Excel and Power point?
Do you have important analytics & business skills as:
Applied Math and Algorithms
Data Processing, Data Knowledge
Descriptive Modelling and Predictive Modelling
Ability to understand, explain and support change
Analytical Ability
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Ability to Synthetise/Simplify
Do you speak English? French is a plus.
If you have all this, a lot of desire, energy, and good mood, then you are the one we are looking for‚Ä¶
We look forward to your application!


Our commitments


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer that is proud to provide equal employment opportunities to all job seekers. As a socially responsible company, we incorporate the principles of Diversity and Inclusion in our values and practices
To achieve all our goals, we intend to attract, develop, and retain different profiles, assuming diversity as an enabler and differentiator of innovation, fundamental in our organization


What makes us proud as reference employer?


Top Employer Portugal and Top Employer Europe certification, for the seventh consecutive year
92% of our employees identify BNP Paribas as a company with "an inclusive management that supports all kinds of differences (age, origins, sexual orientation ...)"
93% of employees identify with and benefit from the "Smart Working" policy, feeling comfortable in a hybrid work environment, and with the digital tools and workspaces available
71% of our customers are promoters of our brand
Show more

Title: Data Visualization Engineer
Description:
Liminal is a global market intelligence and strategic advisory firm specializing in digital identity, financial crime and compliance, and IT security technology solutions across industries while also catering to the private equity and venture capital community. Founded in 2016, Liminal offers strategic and analytical services supporting executive decision-making at all product and business lifecycle stages. We advise some of the world‚Äôs most prominent business leaders, investors, and policymakers on building, acquiring, and investing in the next generation of solutions and technologies. We provide access to proprietary data and analysis, strategic frameworks, and integrated insights on the industry‚Äôs only market intelligence platform.

Every major company in the world has started focusing on the next generation of digital identity technologies as a necessity for continued growth and security. Our team works with a myriad of organizations, from Fortune 100s to startups, across industries including financial services, technology, telecommunications, and the P2P economy. At Liminal, we help businesses build solutions, execute strategies, invest intelligently, and connect with key decision-makers. We know that it‚Äôs in the sharing of discovery and insights that groundwork is laid, problems are solved, and entire sectors advance at the speed of light. Keeping information to ourselves delays progress for all. At Liminal, we don't just respond to the market; we define it.

About The Role

We are seeking a talented and passionate Data Visualization Engineer to join our team and elevate the way users interact with data on Link, our web-based actionable intelligence platform. In this role, you will design and develop intuitive, interactive, and impactful data visualizations that transform complex information into actionable insights. Collaborating closely with product managers, designers, and engineers, you will play a critical role in creating a seamless and engaging user experience. Your expertise in React development and data visualization techniques will be key to delivering meaningful visualizations that drive value for our users.

What You'll Do

Data Visualization Design


Design and implement user-friendly data visualizations that effectively communicate complex information.
Develop interactive charts, graphs, and dashboards using React and modern visualization libraries (e.g., D3.js, Recharts, Chart.js).
Ensure data visualizations are responsive, accessible, and consistent with the platform's design system.
Translate user requirements into intuitive visual representation strategies, optimizing usability and engagement.


Prototyping and Testing


Create and iterate on prototypes to visualize design concepts and gather feedback from stakeholders.
Conduct usability testing to ensure visualizations meet user needs and identify opportunities for improvement.
Use analytics and user feedback to refine and enhance existing visualizations.


Collaboration and Implementation


Work closely with product managers and UX designers to align visualization designs with user and business goals.
Collaborate with front-end engineers to ensure seamless integration and performance optimization of visualizations.
Maintain and improve a reusable visualization component library for consistent implementation across the platform.


Continuous Learning and Development


Stay updated on the latest trends, tools, and best practices in data visualization, React development, and UI/UX design.
Share knowledge and insights with the team to drive innovation and improvement.


Qualifications


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or higher in Computer Science, Data Science, Design, or a related field.
3+ years of experience in data visualization development, preferably for web-based or SaaS platforms.
Proficiency in React and related tools/libraries.
Experience with data visualization libraries such as D3.js, Recharts, or Chart.js.
Experience with data BI tools such as Tableau, Looker, PowerBI
Strong understanding of data visualization principles and the ability to craft visualizations that are both functional and aesthetically pleasing.
Familiarity with responsive design, accessibility standards, and cross-browser compatibility.
Excellent communication skills and ability to collaborate in a cross-functional team environment.
Show more

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Turkish Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.

Title: Data Engineer - Lisbon (Internal Team)
Description:
At Efficio, we're not just a consulting firm; we're a team of dedicated experts committed to transforming procurement and supply chain functions. Our mission is to drive sustainable, measurable value for our clients through innovative solutions and deep industry insights. Join us and be part of a dynamic environment where your skills and ideas make a real impact.

Efficio is the world‚Äôs largest specialist procurement and supply chain consultancy, with offices across Europe, North America, and the Middle East. We‚Äôre a diverse team of over 1,000 individuals, representing more than 60 different nationalities and speaking 40+ languages ‚Äì and we‚Äôre continuing to grow rapidly!

We believe we can make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better. Buying better isn't just about saving money; it's also helping businesses to make the world around them better by buying products and services that that are from green, ethical, sustainable, diverse and inclusive suppliers. At Efficio, we do that by being the world's largest procurement and supply chain consultancy firm. We also do that by combining our procurement expertise with our powerful technology and data to help our customers make better purchasing decisions. Data is a fundamental ingredient to that decision making process and we're now investing heavily in building our in-house data skills, expertise and infrastructure to rival the best in the world. So, if you'd like to make the world a better place by helping businesses buy better, apply here. Please note this role is a non-consulting position.

In this job you will develop and implement data pipelines on AWS, maintain and develop them further under guidance of business owners. You will work alongside Data Scientists, Data Engineers and others; integrated in our Product and Digital team. This role offers the chance to join Efficio at a pivotal point in our data journey, and to shape and influence our data landscape.

This role gives you the opportunity to:


Collect business requirements and translate them into robust and scalable solutions
Demonstrate an understanding of DataOps and develop use case agnostic ETL pipelines
Take a proactive approach to work and become a go-to expert for data cloud migration
Work with state-of-the-art tooling on AWS including Redshift, S3 and ECS
Collaborate with our infrastructure engineers to provision the next generation of tools
Develop a sense of ownership to deliver high quality outcomes for the business
Make complex data more accessible, understandable, and usable by the organisation


We'd love to hear about any additional skills or experiences you bring to the table. We're particularly interested in:


An advanced degree in software engineering, computer science, a related technical field, or relevant work experience
Proven experience in building robust and reliable data pipelines, dealing with a wide variety of data sources
Strong experience in Python, knowledge of data wrangling methodologies and common packages
Proficiency with AWS Tools (e.g., S3, Athena, Glue, Lamba, Kinesis) as well as AWS CI/CD and readiness to learn/work with them
Experience with Docker, Airflow, and SQLs (ideally Postgres)
Fundamental understanding of programming landscape (e.g., APIs, SQL, database management)
Great communication skills, comfortable working collaboratively in cross-functional teams
Ability to manage own workload with a customer focus and solution orientated can-do attitude
Show more

Title: Data Business Analyst (Qlik)
Description:
This is a remote position.

We are looking for a highly skilled Data Business Analyst (Qlik) to play a pivotal role in our team. Your primary focus will be leading the Qlik cloud migration project, translating complex use cases into actionable requirements, and providing innovative solutions.

Key Responsibilities:


Understand and articulate complex business use cases.
Translate requirements into clear, actionable plans.
Lead the Qlik cloud migration project.
Engage in requirements engineering, problem solving, and solution suggesting.
Evaluate, estimate, plan, and execute the migration project.


Requirements


Proven experience in Qlik Cloud
Strong skills in requirements engineering.
Exceptional problem-solving abilities.
Experience in project evaluation, estimation, planning, and execution.


Benefits

Remote work

Food ticket

Health insurance

Training and access to certification vouchers

Work-life balance initiatives

Referral program

Birthday off

Give back day ‚Äì enjoy a day to give back to society!


Show more

Title: Data Understanding Specialist - (Third Party Associate) - Spanish Market- Portugal
Description:
Responsibilities

Important Note: Please be advised that this job posting is for informational purposes only. This is a 6 month temporary assignment managed by HYLegal. All contractual terms, including payroll and benefits, will be handled by HYLegal. By applying, you agree that the information provided in your application may be processed for recruitment purposes, shared with the third-party agency, and other purposes in accordance with ByteDance's Applicant Privacy Notice https://sf16-sg.tiktokcdn.com/obj/eden-sg/uvyloeh7vhonuhf/privacy/ByteDance_Global_Applicant_Privacy_Notice.pdf

TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo.

Why Join Us

Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy - a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always.

At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact - for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us.

The Global Monetization Integrity team ensures safe and quality experiences for Advertisers to enable TikTok in its mission to inspire joy and creativity. The team is responsible for creating scalable and reliable solutions that allow TikTok Advertisers and businesses to interact in a trustworthy manner, always working to anticipate and protect against threats. They will do so by creating ad policies, managing content review processes, and more.

This position will be responsible for meeting the Risk and Moderation demands. This means, as Global Operations Specialist, you will review & moderate advertisements entering the TikTok platform. By doing so, this will mitigate any risk to our community by supporting advertisers proactively, and effectively addressing violations of MI Policies.

Main Responsibilities


SOP Clarification and Training:
Work with the BPs to clarify and eliminate ambiguities in the requirements/SOPs
Provide simplified and straightforward tasks to labellers
Deliver training to labellers for complex requirements
Quality Improvement and Assurance:
Constantly monitor and review the quality of the labelled data
Identify the root cause of any issues and take appropriate remedial actions such as simplify or disambiguate the - - SOPs or provide additional training
Identify opportunities or areas for improvement for key metrics and propose experiments to support initiatives
Project Management:
Ensure timely delivery of projects
Coordinate effectively with key stakeholders
Provide project visibility and progress updates to stakeholders through data


Qualifications

Minimum qualifications:


Fluent in written and spoken required language plus business level English
1-3 years experience in operation for a tech or social media company data analytic experience
Proficiency in data interpretation and analysis; Understanding of AI and Machine Learning concepts, particularly as they relate to data labelling is a plus
Excellent verbal and written communication skills for clear and effective communication with both requestors and labellers
Strong abilities in simplifying complex instructions and requirements, along with robust experience in training in a technical context
Experience in project management with strong organizational skills to manage multiple tasks concurrently, preferably in a data-intensive environment


Preferred Qualifications


Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to identify and resolve issues
Strong technical skills in SQL and scripting languages (Python, R) are a plus
Fluency in English (written and verbal) and an additional language


TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives. Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach. We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
Show more

Title: Data Engineer (Python & Azure)
Description:
Do you want to be part of a company that specializes 100% in its own #Data & #Analytics projects? If so, keep reading! üëÄ

Even though we are relatively unknown to the general public, at SDG we work for half of the IBEX-35 groups and other international companies. Thanks to the analytics boom, we are growing steadily and have been helping our clients understand and analyse their data since 1994.




What makes us different? üßê

In our projects, data and technology are the leaders, we will train you to be able to work with the latest in the market (we have an innovation area where we promote new partnerships with technology manufacturers and R&D centers).
You will have all the opportunities to develop your best self, with a completely customized career plan in which you will learn on your own and also have the support of your colleagues. You will set your own time, you will talk to your manager every six months to share feedback and new challenges, and based on your results, there will be a salary review.
We are a big family, from the first moment we will try to make your life easier. Your colleagues and the rest of the team will always have a smile on their faces and will be ready to help and support you.
You will collaborate and work on a daily basis with great references (technical and/or business), they will be happy to teach you as much as possible and will be proud to see you grow.
Smartwork is possible with us. You will experience a way of working where everyone manages their own time.
We are a brand with purpose. We believe that diversity and inclusion help promote a culture of creativity, allowing us to overcome new situations and challenges as an organization committed to people and society.
Getting into more formal matters, but not less important, we offer a permanent contract, we want you to stay with us for a long time! A competitive salary according to your level of training and experience (don't worry, we will discuss this aspect in the first interview and inform you if your expectations are aligned).




We could go on and on about what makes us special, and we'd love to do it in a phone call. For now, let's show you some details that we're sure you'll find interesting üëáüèº







What will be your mission? ‚úç

Analysis, design and development of solutions and projects in the field of data engineering in Business Intelligence.
Data processing and development of ETL processes.
Creation and modeling of Data Marts in relational, dimensional and/or table environments.
Build and maintain positive relationships with client staff at all levels;
Be updated on the latest technological trends in the field of Analytics.







What will make you succeed in this position? üëá

Bachelor/Master in a field that emphasizes data analysis (Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics).
Experience over 3 years in the field of Analytics, ideally in service/consulting companies.
Experience using Spark and Delta for data processing and analysis.
Familiarity with Azure Data Factory pipelines, as well as deep CI/CD knowledge.
Proficiency in Python programming and SQL Server.
Innovative spirit with balanced customer, business and technology orientation.
Interest in challenges, commitment, integrity, maturity, ability to work as a team and a high sense of responsibility.
Fluent level of English.







Finally, we would like to tell you about the stages of our selection process.




In Our Processes You Will Do 3Ô∏è Meetings

First contact with our People First area (where we will discuss professional growth, salary band and define which areas suit you).
Second technical session where you can surprise us with all your knowledge and skills in technological environments (so we can offer you a project that matches your knowledge and interests).
Meeting with the person in charge of the team you will be joining in order to solve any doubts that may have emerged during the process.







If you have passed all the phases, good news! You will receive a call from People First where we will present our offer for you to join us, and we will be able to answer any questions you may have. When you confirm that you want to be part of the SDG family, we will start preparing everything to welcome you with great enthusiasm.




You can't join us now, but you are interested in SDG Group? Don't worry, you can go through the selection process now and we will consider you for the next job opportunities that match your professional profile.




JOIN NOW, WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

#WeAreSDG #SDGGroup #WhySDG

Show more

  • Getting into more formal matters, but not less important, we offer a permanent contract, we want you to stay with us for a long time! A competitive salary according to your level of training and experience (don't worry, we will discuss this aspect in the first interview and inform you if your expectations are aligned).


We could go on and on about what makes us special, and we'd love to do it in a phone call. For now, let's show you some details that we're sure you'll find interesting üëáüèº



What will be your mission? ‚úç

  • Analysis, design and development of solutions and projects in the field of data engineering in Business Intelligence.
  • Data processing and development of ETL processes.
  • Creation and modeling of Data Marts in relational, dimensional and/or table environments.
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with client staff at all levels;
  • Be updated on the latest technological trends in the field of Analytics.



What will make you succeed in this position? üëá

  • Bachelor/Master in a field that emphasizes data analysis (Computer Science, Information Management, Mathematics, Engineering or Statistics).
  • Experience over 3 years in the field of Analytics, ideally in service/consulting companies.
  • Experience using Spark and Delta for data processing and analysis.
  • Familiarity with Azure Data Factory pipelines, as well as deep CI/CD knowledge.
  • Proficiency in Python programming and SQL Server.
  • Innovative spirit with balanced customer, business and technology orientation.
  • Interest in challenges, commitment, integrity, maturity, ability to work as a team and a high sense of responsibility.
  • Fluent level of English.



Finally, we would like to tell you about the stages of our selection process.


In Our Processes You Will Do 3Ô∏è Meetings

  • First contact with our People First area (where we will discuss professional growth, salary band and define which areas suit you).
  • Second technical session where you can surprise us with all your knowledge and skills in technological environments (so we can offer you a project that matches your knowledge and interests).
  • Meeting with the person in charge of the team you will be joining in order to solve any doubts that may have emerged during the process.



If you have passed all the phases, good news! You will receive a call from People First where we will present our offer for you to join us, and we will be able to answer any questions you may have. When you confirm that you want to be part of the SDG family, we will start preparing everything to welcome you with great enthusiasm.


You can't join us now, but you are interested in SDG Group? Don't worry, you can go through the selection process now and we will consider you for the next job opportunities that match your professional profile.


JOIN NOW, WE LOOK FORWARD TO MEETING YOU!

#WeAreSDG #SDGGroup #WhySDG

Title: Product Analyst - ComparaJ√°
Description:
About us

Our mission is to help consumers save time and money by matching them with the best products for their banking, insurance, and utility needs. We work towards becoming the largest distributor of financial services. ComparaJ√°.pt is part of Samlino Group (https://samlinogroup.com/). We operate across five markets, empowering users reach healthier financial lives.

What we offer you

You'll have the unique opportunity to be a key driver of our exponential growth curve. In your daily work, you will work directly with our Founder and senior teams.

Sunny Lisbon will be your home base, but you'll travel between our five markets (Portugal, Denmark, Belgium, Finland and Greece)!

Your Responsibilities

You will be accountable for your own projects and will be responsible for driving results across various ventures and initiatives. Your responsibilities in this job will evolve and be defined and redefined throughout your time with us. The aim is to take ownership of and drive the development of progressively larger opportunities.

What we expect from you

We are looking for a dynamic individual who thrives in a results-oriented environment to join our team and help us reach our objectives. Industry experience is not a requirement, but you do need to be highly ambitious, proactive, forward-thinking, a fast learner, and driven to succeed.

Furthermore, we are looking for candidates who:


Have a proactive mindset, strong analytical skills, and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams
Are self-motivated, detail-oriented, and possess a track record of successfully owning projects from conception to completion
Possess an unwavering drive and desire to be the very best at what they do
Are passionate about making an impact and driving tangible results
Exude a strong work ethic fueled by an urgency to progress
Embrace ownership and proactively follow through on commitments
Possess an insatiable curiosity about business, data, and people, relishing the opportunity to build and nurture relationships that fuel lasting success
Master communication, wielding words with impact both verbally and in writing
Showcase unrivalled organisational skills, skillfully structuring and prioritising their work to achieve maximum efficiency
Native proficiency in either Portuguese or Danish and fluent in English
EU work permit is required


Start date and Location

Flexible start date

This role is full-time onsite at our Lisbon office

Title: SAP S/4HANA Data Quality and Analysis Analyst ‚Äì Operations
Description:
We are a purpose-led global organisation, dedicated to pushing the boundaries of science to discover and develop life-changing medicines. At AstraZeneca, we take pride in our mission to make a massive difference in the world by saving lives. Our employees are united in their purpose to make a difference to patients around the globe who rely on our medicines and scientific advancements. As we continue to grow, we must work seamlessly across borders with partners and new colleagues. To support this, we are undergoing a large-scale transformation of our IT landscape by replacing our current ERP systems with a global solution.

Our technology is foundational to all AZ entities and central to most core business processes, used by over 20,000 employees daily. This programme offers an opportunity for real transformation, shaping our global ways of working for years to come. We seek the best talent to ensure the success of this programme, which aims to deliver a world-class change initiative that enhances employees' understanding of their roles within our global company. This transformation will provide AZ with a competitive edge, benefiting both employees and patients.

Introduction to role:

The S/4 Data Quality and Analysis Analyst ‚Äì Operations is responsible for supporting the delivery of data quality activities and remediation within the S/4 programme. Aligned with the Operations organisation, this role supports the Data Quality and Analysis Lead by ensuring data readiness for S/4 HANA deployments, compliance with defined standards, and implementing a data quality framework to maintain data integrity post-deployment.

Typical Accountabilities:



Support development of the Operations S/4 Data Quality strategy and roadmap for execution.
Define data quality requirements, metrics, and processes for measuring and reporting across S/4 data objects.
Assist in defining data profiling requirements and provide business interpretation of profiling outputs.
Support Data Design teams in defining data standards through analysis of existing SAP ECC data sets.
Define and document data problem statements and quality improvement plans.
Oversee data quality issue management.
Deliver data quality enhancements at source to simplify S/4HANA data migration.
Support impact assessments, design, and management of interim state reporting during deployment.
Contribute to the development of the S/4 Cleanse and Migrate strategy and execution plans.
Define the scope of data cleansing and delivery approach aligned with the cleanse and migrate strategy.
Establish a data quality organisation and framework for ongoing monitoring and remediation.
Ensure alignment with the S/4 Data Governance framework.
Contribute to the development of the S/4 Data Governance Strategy and Roadmap.
Establish ‚Äúkeep clean‚Äù capabilities into BAU.



Essential Skills/Experience:



Strong functional experience in data quality management including data quality rules, data quality reporting, issue management, and issue remediation.
Specialist knowledge of data quality management principles and practices (including data profiling, data discovery, root cause analysis, designing and implementing automated DQ solutions).
Proven track record in applying leading-edge data quality enhancement capabilities covering profiling, analysis, migration, cleanse to land step-change in data quality.
Experience in managing complex data quality analysis and improvement projects.
Demonstrated ability to lead in a diverse, global team within and across functions. Experience with global working and across cultures.
Strong communication skills with the ability to influence others to achieve objectives.
Ability to lead and manage negotiations across a complex group to a target outcome.
Proven track record of delivery and ability to effectively prioritise to ensure goals and outcomes are achieved.
Good understanding of Master Data Management and Reference Data Management.
Ability to work with business users to elicit and formally define their requirements.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Able to lead conflicting priorities.
Working knowledge of SAP ECC Modules.



Desirable Skills/Experience:



Good understanding of or experience in other data-related capabilities including data architecture, data analytics, data modelling, self-assessment, policy assurance, quality assurance, and control testing.
Previous experience with data management tools.
S/4 HANA implementation programme experience.
Experience in life sciences and healthcare.
Experience in Data Governance.
In-depth knowledge of relevant key business processes.
Demonstrable knowledge of transactions and reporting in an SAP environment, including an understanding of how data integrates within an SAP architecture.
Understanding of data concepts and experience in data management capabilities including data lineage, data definitions, and data governance.
Experience of Business/IT partnering for the implementation of Data Governance-related solutions.



At AstraZeneca, we live and breathe a digital mindset, striving to be at the forefront of the convergence of science, data, and technology. We are transforming how we discover and develop new medicines to create the greatest impact on disease. By embracing digital and data, we are putting patients at the heart of everything we do. Here you will combine your skills with technology to drive innovation, transform processes, and optimise outcomes.

Join us on this exciting journey! Apply now to be part of our transformative programme.

  • Understanding of data concepts and experience in data management capabilities including data lineage, data definitions, and data governance.
  • Experience of Business/IT partnering for the implementation of Data Governance-related solutions.


At AstraZeneca, we live and breathe a digital mindset, striving to be at the forefront of the convergence of science, data, and technology. We are transforming how we discover and develop new medicines to create the greatest impact on disease. By embracing digital and data, we are putting patients at the heart of everything we do. Here you will combine your skills with technology to drive innovation, transform processes, and optimise outcomes.

Join us on this exciting journey! Apply now to be part of our transformative programme.

Portuguese company hires for remote / hybrid work

Sector: Telecom Industry

Instructions: Please submit your resume in English and include all skills and experience that meet the requirements of the position. This will significantly increase your chances of success.

Your Role


Design, develop, and maintain ELTL processes, leveraging expertise in Big Data technologies.
Actively contribute to technical discussions within the team.
Understand business requirements and translate them into technical solutions.


Your Profile


Degree in Computer Engineering or a related field.
2+ years of experience in data engineering.
Fluent Portuguese (Native) and Advanced English.
Strong communication and teamwork skills.
Experience with Agile methodologies.

Data Warehouse / Data Lake architecture.
SQL (Procedures, Views, Triggers).

Title: Senior Data Analyst Regulatory Data Management
Description:
About The Team


CCCO Central is a transversal CIB team based in Paris and Lisbon and is part of the CIB functions.
CCCO Central acts, on behalf of the CIB CCCO (‚ÄúCIB Chief Conduct and Control Officer‚Äù) as a liaison between the second lines of defense (RISK ORM and Compliance) and the regional and business lines CCCOs of CIB in all their projects in regards with the management of non-financial risk (including regulatory, compliance, business process, conduct, etc.)
CCCO Central ensure that (i) CIB controls regulatory objectives are met, (ii) Permanent Control and Group policy impacts are properly coordinated and guided, (iii) CIB implication in Supervisory affairs is properly monitored and (iv) transversal initiatives are fully reviewed in light of permanent control.


About The Job


Create business-facing dashboards and high impact data visualizations and analyses with complex data structures which will support BNPParibas Internal or External clients achieve their objectives in terms of revenue generation, efficiency creation, production levels and risk management.


Your Main Activities Are


Collaborate with internal/external clients to best understand their operational and strategic needs.
Create descriptive, predictive and quantitative analyses addressing key business priorities and supporting the stakeholders' decision making.
Support and monitor the run of these activities of data analysis, reporting and data mining.
Contribute to disseminate a culture of data driven solutions within BNP Paribas.
Provide visibility on performance and activities of BNP Paribas to stakeholders


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelor's degree in Information Technology and Computer Science or other related areas
2 years minimum relevant professional experience in Data Analytics
English fluent
Proficient in Tableau, Power BI and SQL server
Proficient in IT - Business - IT relationship
Strong analytical skills (Ability to synthetize and understand complex projects or processes
Advanced knowledge of data management (data integrity, consistency, ownership, ‚Ä¶)
Ability to develop and adapt a process
Strong communication skills, written and spoken
Highly organized and with the ability to multi-task
Rigorous and autonomous
Results driven - delivers high quality, and high impact work
Ability to analyze issues and prioritize based on potential impact
Team player with high ethics


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union‚Äôs leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group‚Äôs retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal

  • Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Data Engineer
HTML:
Expleo is a trusted partner for your innovation journey. As a global engineering, technology and consulting service provider, we are ideally positioned to help you achieve your ambitions and future-proof your business. With a smart blend of bold thinking and reliable execution, we‚Äôre able to fast-track innovation through each step of your value chain.

We are strategically positioned to build value, with a global footprint across 30 countries.

We are as global and local as you need us to be, with strong best-in-class pan-European technological centres and unique best-shoring capabilities.

We leverage a network of high value-adding affiliates in consulting and industrial excellence, and leading partners across multiple sectors to provide you with the most comprehensive services and solutions in an ever-changing environment.

Essential Skills

  • Minimum of 3 years experience in a similar role;
  • Proficiency in data modeling, ETL and Data Warehousing;
  • Experience with Azure with a strong focus on Microsoft Fabric;
  • Proven experience with Python, SQL or similar;
  • Knowledge of CI/CD;
  • Good knowledge of English.

Title: Mid Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst, for a project based in Lisbon.




Responsibilities:

Analytical and communication skills, interpersonal relationships, creativity, initiative and proactivity
Compiling information/preparing reports to support decision-making;
Creating User Stories for the Data Warehouse;
Data modeling in the Data Warehouse;
Collecting adhoc data from commercial and/or analytical systems.




Requirements:

Up to 5 years' experience as a Data Analyst
Knowledge of SQL language
Knowledge of the SQL language, Office tools and, in particular, Excel at an advanced level;
Fluency in English.




If you‚Äôre interested in this job please send your CV to or liliana.moreno@decskill.com with reference ‚ÄúLM/Data Analyst‚Äù.




#letsgrowtogether üöÄ




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Description:
At Gopuff, we‚Äôre not just delivering convenience‚Äîwe‚Äôre redefining how the world shops. Since pioneering instant needs in 2013, we‚Äôve empowered millions of customers across the U.S. and U.K. to reclaim their time through seamless, fast, and reliable delivery. Behind this transformative journey is our tech-first mindset, relentless obsession with customer experience and operational excellence.

Now, we‚Äôre building something even bigger. We‚Äôre establishing a core hub in Lisbon, Portugal and we‚Äôre looking for an exceptional Lead Data Analyst to shape the future of quick commerce.

This is not just a job‚Äîit‚Äôs a mission. As a Lead Data Analyst, you‚Äôll own the transformation of raw data into game-changing insights, fuelling the decisions that drive our business forward.

You‚Äôll partner with cross-functional teams, challenge the status quo and make high-impact recommendations that influence company-wide KPIs. With your mastery of SQL, Python and advanced analytics, you won‚Äôt just support decisions‚Äîyou‚Äôll lead them.

We believe great work happens through collaboration, not competition. You foster a culture of curiosity, respect, and shared success, ensuring data is a tool for empowerment, not gatekeeping. No room for arrogance‚Äîjust a commitment to helping others and making an impact together.

If you‚Äôre a high-performer who thrives in fast-paced, high-impact environments, this is your chance to build, innovate, and leave a lasting mark on one of the most disruptive industries in the world.

Are you ready to shape the future of commerce? Let‚Äôs go. üöÄ

You Will:


Analyse and enhance key metrics across customer acquisition, retention, and revenue generation to drive business efficiency, optimise cost-effectiveness, and elevate customer satisfaction.
Develop and maintain advanced data models using dbt to deliver transparency and clarity into core business performance metrics, ensuring alignment with strategic KPIs.
Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams‚Äîincluding Category Management, Growth, and Finance‚Äîto translate data insights into actionable strategies that improve processes and drive measurable outcomes.
Conduct deep dives into company performance to identify areas for improvement, uncover opportunities for efficiency, and ensure KPIs align with overarching business objectives.
Solve complex, real-world challenges by leveraging data to deliver practical solutions that enhance operational excellence and fuel company growth.
Present data insights in a clear and compelling manner to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, ensuring decisions are informed by robust analysis.


You Have:


Proven Data Analytics Expertise: 3-5 years of hands-on experience in data analytics, ideally in a fast-paced, high-growth e-commerce or retail environment, where you‚Äôve delivered impactful insights that drive business success.
Fluency in English: Exceptional communication skills in English, enabling you to effectively collaborate with global teams and present complex data insights to diverse audiences.
Outstanding Technical Skills: Advanced proficiency in SQL, Python, Looker, and dbt, with a proven track record of querying large datasets, building complex reports, and developing scalable data models that empower decision-making.
Mastery of Data Visualisation and Reporting Tools: Deep familiarity with tools like Looker, Tableau, or Power BI, with a talent for transforming raw data into strategic insights and actionable recommendations.
Analytical Problem-Solver: A natural problem-solver with a passion for tackling complex business challenges, identifying opportunities for improvement, and delivering innovative, data-driven solutions.
High-Performing and Self-Motivated: A self-starter who thrives in dynamic environments, consistently pushing boundaries to deliver excellence and make a tangible impact on the business.
Strong Communicator: Ability to present data insights clearly and persuasively to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including leadership.


Company Summary & EEOC Statement:

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it‚Äîstuff happens. But that‚Äôs where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.

And now, we‚Äôre assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.

Like what you‚Äôre hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.

Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

Description:

Time Type: Full Time

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2‚Äì4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English
